title: unable to connect to login queue
body:
Everytime i try to login in it goes to the loading screen and back to the home page saying unable to connect to login queue.
Please help as soon as possible.

replies.body: It sounds like your connection is struggling to get to the game server.  I recommend going over the steps in our [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to troubleshoot any blocks or hiccups preventing your network from reaching us.  Test it in a custom, and let me know if you have any questions!

> [{quoted}](name=Porocles,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=9mptZ8HM,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-08-19T16:56:32.990+0000)
>
> It sounds like your connection is struggling to get to the game server.  I recommend going over the steps in our [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to troubleshoot any blocks or hiccups preventing your network from reaching us.  Test it in a custom, and let me know if you have any questions!

Porocles. It appears that this issue is affecting all of us around the Denver, CO area. any tips on how to proceed?

Hey!  I've reached out to our tech team and they've also received reports of impacted connections around the Denver area too.  I'm trying to get more info, but we don't have a lot of visibility over ISPs or their nodes.  I'm trying to find out if the issue is isolated to a single ISP for example, or if there's anything we can do on our side.  

For now, your best bet would be to grab traceroutes via [WinMTR](http://winmtr.net/winmtr-v0-92-now-available/) while routing to 104.160.131.1 (NA region) and give them to your ISP.  Reach out to them, let them know what's going on, and offer those logs so they can review the situation.

Hopefully, the nodes causing these issues or anything else going on can be repaired in no time!

--VPN may assist in the meantime, but only temporarily and could cause higher ping.  The key is to resolve the origin of the problem!
Do you have an update on this Porocles?
Thank you for this Porocles. I was just about to post something similar to this haha.

> [{quoted}](name=Porocles,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=9mptZ8HM,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2017-08-19T19:40:13.298+0000)
>
> Hey!  I've reached out to our tech team and they've also received reports of impacted connections around the Denver area too.  I'm trying to get more info, but we don't have a lot of visibility over ISPs or their nodes.  I'm trying to find out if the issue is isolated to a single ISP for example, or if there's anything we can do on our side.

> 
> Hopefully, the nodes causing these issues or anything else going on can be repaired in no time!

Using that IP with winmtr I'm getting no packet loss and a max of 56 average ping I'm not seeing anything that may cause the problem of not being able to log in. Any idea why that is? I've opened a 2nd ticket now since I had closed the first one assuming it was Comcasts problem but have yet to hear a response back.

What error message are you receiving when attempting to login?  Make sure to run the tool for about 5 minutes as well, it may not pickup the issue right away.  Toss me your ticket number, I'll take a look and share it with the team to see what's going on and get back to you there.

heres what they are having me do, you should do likely and upload to your ticket:
"In the Host field, please enter in the one of the following address for the server you're currently playing on and click Start.

NA Server:
192.64.170.252
and
104.160.131.1
and
google.com

For each test, run it for five minutes, press the STOP button, export to text, and attach it to your reply.

As a temporary workaround to your ISP issue, you can try using a VPN. The following VPNs are free to use and cross-platform!
CyberGhost
Hotspot Shield"
Ah yeah that first IP is giving me 100% packet loss after a few hops with no response from host right after I started it :/

> [{quoted}](name=A Danish Pastry,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=9mptZ8HM,comment-id=00000000000000000000000300000000,timestamp=2017-08-19T21:16:25.171+0000)
>
> Ah yeah that first IP is giving me 100% packet loss after a few hops with no response from host right after I started it :/

https://www.cyberghostvpn.com/en_US/apps/windows-vpn/download/latest free vpn....itll route you through somewhere else. i'm routing through texas and can play
Yeah there are plenty of VPNs to get on problem is I don't wanna play with my ping being higher than normal :/

> [{quoted}](name=A Danish Pastry,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=9mptZ8HM,comment-id=0000000000000000000000030000000000010000,timestamp=2017-08-19T22:10:00.910+0000)
>
> Yeah there are plenty of VPNs to get on problem is I don't wanna play with my ping being higher than normal :/

Not effecting my ping...and that's the only solution that rito could give me in my ticket so far. Besides they say a lot of people have the issue and they are working on it. Best of luck my friend and for both of our sakes hopefully it is solved soon

I gave it a shot the VPN TunnelBear gave me the best connection at 120ms but CyberGhost gave me over 220ms and I normally only get like 45-50ms so both were too much laggier than normal to make playing any fun. 

Also tried the service Haste which is supposed to be for LoL and Overwatch specifically but that actually gave me the same login problems as without a VPN so rip me until this is fixed I guess

Edit: Tried the VPN WTFast and it works perfectly nearly the same ping as normal at 52ms so I'm just gonna use this until it's working again

Thanks for the traceroute, we also received your ticket response as well.  I have to say I was a bit blown away at your first hop.  That ping is outrageously high, well before you leave your own local network.  Have you had a chance to run through our [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide yet?  While you might be impacted by these node issues, you might have additional problems stemming from home as well.  It would be good to cut down those troubles!

Hi again Porocles, 
That first hop was a fluke....after running it for awhile but thanks for the concern. my first step before delving into the forums and creating a ticket was to go through every step of the guide :)

edit: avg ping of 11
edit edit: that ping on the local was because i forgot i unplugged my ethernet cord when i was trouble shooting earlier, not that it is plugged back in the local ping is 0

The ticket number is 31442256 and right now the error it's giving is "An unexpected error occurred while logging in. Please try again. If this issue persists, contact support at support.riotgames.com".

Also quick question for ya. Inside WinMTR I noticed a setting in options where you can change the amount of packets being sent with the default being 1 per second. Should I change that to a different number and retest?

I tired all of the tips you guys recommended but noone of them worked. 
Please help as soon as possible
Solved for me: go to the folder of the game exe location ---> start the game from the old launcher: " lol.launcher.admin.exe" worked for me =]
Did nothing for me. I believe the problem we're having is with some host having problems in CO whereas you don't have to worry about that being in EU

I'm having issues with logging in as well, it gets stuck on the authentication screen. I'm with comcast in Aurora Colorado. There was people in the other thread that got locked though who weren't on Comcast, not sure where they were though.
It seems like they were also from this area though...I want to call comcast i'm just not sure what to say to them to describe the issue in a way theyd understand
Yeah I tried calling them and they had no clue what I was talking about it was super frustrating and ended with them telling me it wasn't their problem.
